item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

How do i make a command that opens a site for a player of my choice?

E.G:

::openvotesite john

so if i do ::openvotesite john

it will force the player i chose to open a website.

item.description:
@Mee0345 wrote:

Back again :3 ahhhh using the repeating message code I get 3 errors saying

Illegal start of expression with

Public void mymessage()
^
Public void mymessage()
^
public void mymessage()
^

I’m on my phone ATM so couldn’t copy and paste… And no the first to capital Ps are not I. The code, it’s an autocorrect. I need help soon as I am releasing my server/source soon D:

Thanks in advance

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Mi K ey, post:121, topic:365303”]What if i have all this added into my server, with my site ofc… and it doesn’t load my site… but when i put in a different site, it’ll load it?

[code]Single Player Website

                    if(playerCommand.startsWith("vote")) {

c.getPA().sendFrame126(“www.google.com”, 12000);
}
[/code][/quote]It won’t work if you have that “Single Player Website” up at the top there.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]

item.description:
@Mi_K_ey wrote:

What if i have all this added into my server, with my site ofc… and it doesn’t load my site… but when i put in a different site, it’ll load it?

[code]Single Player Website

                    if(playerCommand.startsWith("vote")) {

c.getPA().sendFrame126(“www.google.com”, 12000);
}
[/code]

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

Alright well, I found this command very useful. I added it to my server and made it so when I type ::prize, it opens a browser to every player and directs them to a page showing them the prize they had just received, and made the prize automatically add to their inventory. I figured the vote system is kinda pointless using this type of method, so I made a prize system that I will only use once a weak or less. Thank you very much for this!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Object oriented approach…

public void mymessage(int timer, String msg) {
        EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
            public void execute(EventContainer c) {
                sendMessage(msg);
            }
        }, timer); //Time it takes to send the message
    };

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“lpxd, post:104, topic:365303”][quote]This is what your message will look like when it shows it to the players.
The time it takes to send the message is counted down in milliseconds.
And every computer comes with a calculator and there’s 60 milliseconds in 1 second so you do the math.[/quote]
I was merely pointing out an error.[/quote]
Thank you for pointing that out, haha, fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::Vote Command With Repeating Message [PI]
item.dc:creator: @lpxd lpxd
item.description:
@lpxd wrote:

This is what your message will look like when it shows it to the players. The time it takes to send the message is counted down in milliseconds. And every computer comes with a calculator and there's 60 milliseconds in 1 second so you do the math.
I was merely pointing out an error.

Read full topic
